modules.description: This module converts a Mirage flow into Lwt_io input and output channels, enabling use of Lwt_io operations like reading lines or writing strings. It works directly with Mirage flows and Lwt_io channels, handling buffer configuration and closure behavior. Concrete use cases include adapting network or file flows for line-based input processing or formatted output in Lwt-based applications.

This module implements low-level I/O operations for file descriptors in a MirageOS-compatible way, providing functions to read from and write to flows using `Cstruct.t` buffers. It supports single-buffer writes, vectorized writes, controlled shutdown of read and write directions, and safe closure of flows. These operations are specifically designed for use with Lwt-based asynchronous networking code, such as handling TCP connections or Unix domain sockets in MirageOS unikernels.

This module converts Mirage flows into Lwt_io channels for line-based and formatted I/O operations, and provides low-level file descriptor handling with support for buffer operations and flow control. It works directly with Mirage flows and Lwt_io channels, using `Cstruct.t` buffers for efficient data transfer. Use cases include adapting TCP or Unix domain socket flows for Lwt-based networking applications and managing asynchronous file I/O in MirageOS unikernels.
